intro: Helipterum sesamoides, commonly known as the yellow sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Helipterum sesamoides is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
